channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Californians are sick of the 'malaise that's plagued' the state, says CEO who plans to build new city in the Bay Area—and he's submitted 20,000 signatures to prove it
item.description: The Silicon Valley-backed campaign to build a green city in the San Francisco Bay Area has submitted what it says are enough signatures to qualify for the November election.

item.title: Pfizer beats revenue estimates, raises profit outlook on cost cuts and strong non-Covid sales
item.description: The results come as Pfizer tries to regain its footing after the rapid decline of its Covid business.

item.title: Deliveroo driver bit off customer's thumb—now U.K. government cracks down on account sharing
item.description: Delivery platforms will carry out enhanced checks on riders, as substitute rider Jennifer Roche faces a prison sentence for attacking a customer.

item.title: Yum Brands earnings miss estimates as Pizza Hut, KFC sales disappoint
item.description: KFC and Pizza Hut reported same-store sales declines, while Taco Bell's same-store sales rose just 1%.

item.title: Aston Martin's first quarter earnings drop 34% as it awaits fourth CEO in four years
item.description: The luxury carmaker shipped 945 vehicles in the period, a 26% decline from the prior year, while revenue dropped 10% to $334 million.

item.title: Demand for riskier adjustable-rate mortgages hits highest level of the year, due to rising rates
item.description: The share of ARM applications rose to 7.8% of mortgage demand last week, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association. That is the highest level of the year.

item.title: Novo Nordisk's market value of $570 billion is now bigger than the entire Danish economy—creating a 'Nokia risk' for Denmark
item.description: “When you have superpowers, you have super responsibility," says CEO Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen.

item.title: CVS posts big earnings miss, cuts profit outlook on higher medical costs
item.description: CVS and other insurers have seen medical costs spike as many Medicare Advantage patients return to hospitals to undergo procedures they delayed during Covid.

item.title: Geely-backed Polestar pushes back results for second time in a year, as the Swedish carmaker battles accounting errors
item.description: The EV maker is relying on new models such as the Polestar 4 coupe to bolster sales.

item.title: Johnson & Johnson will pay $6.5 billion to resolve nearly all talc ovarian cancer lawsuits in U.S.
item.description: The deal would allow J&J to resolve the lawsuits through a third bankruptcy filing of a subsidiary company, LTL Management.
